metadata.title: CVE-2024-50028 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:thermal: core: Reference count the zone in thermal_zone_get_by_id()There are places in the thermal netlink code where nothing preventsthe thermal zone object from going away while being accessed after ithas been returned by thermal_zone_get_by_id().To address this, make thermal_zone_get_by_id() get a reference on thethermal zone device object to be returned with the help of get_device(),under thermal_list_lock, and adjust all of its callers to this changewith the help of the cleanup.h infrastructure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-50028` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19

No subscription required
